channel.title: Resisting Enlightenment
channel.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
channel.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out
channel.description: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out
channel.itunes:author: Antsy McClain

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #1 I freaked out Rodney Crowell
item.description: Episode 1: I Freaked Out Rodney Crowell Singer/songwriter Antsy McClain talks with his buddy, Chris "Spoons" Long about the time he met Rodney Crowell in a Nashville arts supply store and totally made a fool of himself. Songs featured: "Don't Go Looking Back That Way" from The Beige Album. Antsy McClain's music, books, artwork and more at www.unhitched.com
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #2 What are you afraid of?
item.description: Episode 2: What Are You Afraid Of? Antsy McClain and Chris "Spoons" Long discuss what they fear the most in life. Songs featured: "My Own Way" from the album, Under the Light of a Quarter Moon. Antsy McClain's music, books, artwork and more at www.unhitched.com
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #3 12 years old on the inside
item.description: Episode 3: 12-Years-Old On The Inside Antsy McClain talks with cartoonist and musician Robert Armstrong about staying young at heart as we get older. Songs featured: "When You're Laughing" from the album, New Good Old Days. Antsy McClain's music, books, artwork and more at www.unhitched.com
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #4 I was a teenage bed wetter
item.description: Episode 4: I Was a Teenage Bed Wetter Antsy McClain talks - and laughs a lot - with his wife Deana Lynn about music, art, family and the strangely taboo topic of bed wetting. Songs featured: "I'll Be Me and You Be You" from the Somewhere Past These Gravel Roads album sessions, never released before); "No More Wishful Thinking" from the album, Under the Light of a Quarter Moon; "Like a River," from the album, Limited Edition Prince. Antsy McClain's music, books, artwork and more at www.unhitched.com
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #5 Surviving Disaster
item.description: Episode 5: Surviving Disaster Singer songwriter Antsy McClain reaches out to friends dealing with the California wildfires, sharing a mix tape of sorts: songs that might help in times of loss. Antsy also shares a link to his friends at Operation Song, a group of Nashville songwriters using their powers for good in assistance to military veterans with PTSD.
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #6 Sacred Clowns
item.description: Episode 6: Sacred Clowns Singer songwriter Antsy McClain muses on the lovable people who make us laugh. Songs include: Inspector 372 (Live); Another Happy Song; When You’re Laughing; I’m Gonna Be Happy If It Kills Me, and a brand new song in demo form called, Ain’t That a lot Like Life? which will be on his upcoming album due out in the Spring of 2019.
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #7 Girls, fear and the love song of John Davidson
item.description: Episode 7: Girls, fear and the love song of John Davidson Singer songwriter Antsy McClain talks with his friend Chris "Spoons" Long about their fear of girls when they were young, imitations of Steve Martin and the glorious masculinity of John Davidson. Songs include: Ella May; Out on a Limb and Larry Anne.
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #8 Perseverance
item.description: Episode 8: Singer/songwriter Antsy McClain confesses that he almost quit many times over the years. But recent experiences have given him an appreciation for his 25 years in the entertainment business. He has words of encouragement for young artists embarking on the difficult but rewarding path toward authenticity. Songs include Right Side of the Dirt and All in the Trip.
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #9 My History with Smoke
item.description: Singer/songwriter Antsy McClain shares a humorous essay about his complicated history with smoking, from his childhood in the 70’s in a family where tobacco use was ubiquitous, to his adulthood and where he stands now. Songs include “A Poor Man’s Education,” “Time Machine” and “Conditional Love.” Antsy McClain's music, books, artwork and more at www.unhitched.com.
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Episode Resisting Enlightenment #10 - What is Worthiness?
item.description: Singer/songwriter Antsy McClain shares a favorite childhood memory of his father – and how he kinda screwed it up, as well as his thoughts on the contrived concept of "worthiness." Songs include "Don't Stop to Rest," I'm Gonna Be Happy If It Kills Me" and "No More Wishful Thinking." Find Antsy McClain's music, books and artwork at unhitched.com.
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #11 Death
item.description: Singer/songwriter Antsy McClain explores life and death, and more specifically, why some want to end their lives early by their own hand. McClain looks into many recent well-known celebrity suicides, and asks some heart-felt questions. Songs include "Right Side of the Dirt," "We're All Gonna Die" and "Drive Thru Life."
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment # 12 - Nashville Field Trip 6/16/19
item.description: Singer/songwriter Antsy McClain shares moments from a recent Nashville Field Trip, a quarterly event he hosts with his wife, Deana Lynn. Music from Tim and Myles Thompson, Mare Wakefield & Nomad and Kevin Ward are featured along with a live version of Antsy's song "A Life Like Ours" featuring Chris "Spoons" Long on drums, Blake Branch on bass and Nomad on melodica.
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #13 - Road Tripping 6/16/19
item.description: Singer/songwriter Antsy McClain shares conversations from a recent road trip with talented Nashville musicians Myles Thompson and Chris "Spoons" Long. They talk about life, music and the intestinal fortitude it takes to go on the road. Songs include "Larry Anne," "Time Machine," "Don't Stop to Rest" and "Drive Thru Life."
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
item.itunes:summary: Singer/Songwriter Antsy McClain unwisely revisits the painful moments of our lives, and laughs with you as we all try to figure it out

item.itunes:author: Antsy McClain
item.title: Resisting Enlightenment #14 - More Road Tripping 8/13/19
item.description: Singer/songwriter Antsy McClain goes on a long road trip with drummer Chris "Spoons" Long, guitarist Edgar Cruz and neighbor Niles Ingalls. The trip is wrought with misadventure, including a run-in with a State Trooper, horrendous Summer storms and a strange encounter at a rest stop.
item.itunes:subtitle: The podcast that unwisely revisits those awkward moments that keep us up at night.
